summary: Thomas W. Sacco was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are certification reports and payroll certifications that list Sacco's name, position, and salary during the period from May to November 1978. While the specific role of Thomas W. Sacco within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, the records confirm his employment and compensation during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Thomas W. Sacco's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations, which investigated the JFK assassination. The documents serve as evidence of his involvement in the committee's operations, although the exact nature and extent of his contribution are not specified.
